info.title: Teable App
info.description: Manage Data as easy as drink a cup of tea

get.description: Retrieve a single record by its ID with options to specify field projections and output format.

schema.description: If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained, The parameter value depends on the specified fieldKeyType to determine whether it is name or id
Define the return value formate, you can set it to text if you only need simple string value
Define the key type of record.fields[key], You can click "systemInfo" in the field edit box to get fieldId or enter the table design screen with all the field details

name.description: primary field value

fields.description: Objects with a fields key mapping fieldId or field name to value for that field.

autoNumber.description: Auto number, a unique identifier for each record

createdTime.description: Created time, date ISO string (new Date().toISOString).

lastModifiedTime.description: Last modified time, date ISO string (new Date().toISOString).

patch.description: Update a single record by its ID with support for field value typecast and record reordering.

fieldKeyType.description: Define the key type of record.fields[key], You can click "systemInfo" in the field edit box to get fieldId or enter the table design screen with all the field details

typecast.description: Automatic data conversion from cellValues if the typecast parameter is passed in. Automatic conversion is disabled by default to ensure data integrity, but it may be helpful for integrating with 3rd party data sources.

fields.description: Objects with a fields key mapping fieldId or field name to value for that field.

viewId.description: You can only specify order in one view when create record (will create a order index automatically)

anchorId.description: The record id to anchor to

order.description: Where this record to insert to (Optional)

get.description: Retrieve a list of records with support for filtering, sorting, grouping, and pagination. The response includes record data and optional group information.

schema.description: If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained, The parameter value depends on the specified fieldKeyType to determine whether it is name or id
Define the return value formate, you can set it to text if you only need simple string value
Define the key type of record.fields[key], You can click "systemInfo" in the field edit box to get fieldId or enter the table design screen with all the field details
Set the view you want to fetch, default is first view. result will filter and sort by view options.
When a viewId is specified, configure this to true will ignore the view's filter, sort, etc
A filter object used to filter results. It allows complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values.
Search for records that match the specified field and value

Filter out the records that can be selected by a given link cell from the relational table. For example, if the specified field is one to many or one to one relationship, recordId for which the field has already been selected will not appear.

Filter out selected records based on this link cell from the relational table. Note that viewId, filter, and orderBy will not take effect in this case because selected records has it own order. Ignoring recordId gets all the selected records for the field
Filter selected records by record ids
An array of sort objects that specifies how the records should be ordered.
An array of group objects that specifies how the records should be grouped.
An array of group ids that specifies which groups are collapsed
The record count you want to take, maximum is 2000
The records count you want to skip

post.description: Create a new field in the specified table with the given configuration

type.description: The field types supported by teable.

name.description: The name of the field. can not be duplicated in the table.

unique.description: Whether this field is not unique.

notNull.description: Whether this field is not null.

dbFieldName.description: Field(column) name in backend database. Limitation: 1-63 characters, can only contain letters, numbers and underscore, case sensitive, cannot be duplicated with existing db field name in the table.

isLookup.description: Whether this field is lookup field. witch means cellValue and [fieldType] is looked up from the linked table.

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

linkFieldId.description: The id of Linked record field to use for lookup

filter.description: A filter object used to filter results. It allows complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values.

lookupOptions.description: The lookup options for field, you need to configure it when isLookup attribute is true or field type is rollup.

timeZone.description: The time zone that should be used to format dates

date.description: the display formatting of the date.

time.description: the display formatting of the time.

timeZone.description: The time zone that should be used to format dates

anyOf.description: caveat: the formatting is just a formatter, it dose not effect the storing value of the record

formatting.description: Different cell value types are determined based on the results of expression parsing, where numbers, dates, and formatting options are provided

type.description: can display as url, email or phone in string field with a button to perform the corresponding action, start a phone call, send an email, or open a link in a new tab
can display as bar or ring in number field with single cellValue value

showValue.description: whether to displays the specific value on the graph

maxValue.description: the value that represents a 100% maximum value, it does not represent a hard limit on the value

type.description: can display as bar or line in number field with multiple cellValue value

showAs.description: According to the results of expression parsing to determine different visual effects, where strings, numbers will provide customized "show as"

expression.description: The formula including fields referenced by their IDs. For example, LEFT(4, {Birthday}) input will be returned as LEFT(4, {fldXXX}) via API.

get.description: Retrieve record and field identifiers based on the selected range coordinates in a table

schema.description: Set the view you want to fetch, default is first view. result will filter and sort by view options.
When a viewId is specified, configure this to true will ignore the view's filter, sort, etc
A filter object used to filter results. It allows complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values.
Search for records that match the specified field and value

Filter out the records that can be selected by a given link cell from the relational table. For example, if the specified field is one to many or one to one relationship, recordId for which the field has already been selected will not appear.

Filter out selected records based on this link cell from the relational table. Note that viewId, filter, and orderBy will not take effect in this case because selected records has it own order. Ignoring recordId gets all the selected records for the field
Filter selected records by record ids
An array of sort objects that specifies how the records should be ordered.
An array of group objects that specifies how the records should be grouped.
An array of group ids that specifies which groups are collapsed
If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained
The parameter "ranges" is used to represent the coordinates [column, row][] of a selected range in a table.
Types of non-contiguous selections
